Description: Tube (veil or sleeve?) of cherry red silk (a), simple tabby, upper part missing, finishing in a separately woven fringe (b). (a) tube made of four pieces of silk, cut on the bias, joined at two vertical and two diagonal seams. Warp: silk without twist, ca 45 ends/cm Weft: silk without twist, ca 56 picks/cm Edges: two plain selvedges in both diagonal seams, other edges hidden or fragmentary Sewing threads: Z-twist S-ply silk; vertical seams: run and fell stitch; diagonal seams: overcast; braid attached with running stitch (on the inside) (b) red silk fringe formed by extending the weft of a red, yellow and blue silk braid with yellow chevrons down the centre; tablet-woven ?; traces of silver filaments on the yellow threads. Warp: Z-twist S-ply silk, ca 52 ends in 12mm; well spaced silver strip Z-wound around yellow threads Weft: Z-twist S-ply silk, ca 15 picks/cm Edges: one plain selvedge, one fringe, two cut ends Sewing threads: Z-twist S-ply silk; vertical seams: run and fell stitch; diagonal seams: overcast; braid attached with running stitch (on the inside)
Curator's comments: History of use: bias cutting seams to imply tight fit, eg. a tunic sleeve; but a possible use was as a woman's face veil: compare to 1904,0314.43.
Condition: Fragmentary and holed; fringe fair in places. Conservation: unknown dat, stuck to sticky wet.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
